feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued October 11 at 7:33AM AKDT until October 12 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 45 to 60 mph with gusts up to 75 mph becoming northwest expected. * WHERE...Western Aleutians. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 AM AKDT Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Aleutians

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued October 11 at 7:33AM AKDT until October 12 at 5:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 50 to 65 mph with gusts up to 80 mph becoming west expected. * WHERE...Central Aleutians. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 5 PM AKDT Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WINDS POSSIBLE FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... A strong North Pacific low lifts into the Western Bering Sea today. The front will push eastward across the Bering to the Eastern Aleutians by late tonight into early Thursday morning. South winds of 30 to 45 mph with gusts up 65 mph will be possible
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE BERING BRINGING HIGH WINDS TO THE PRIBILOF ISLANDS... A North Pacific low is going to rapidly intensify as it moves north. The surface low will be north of Adak Thursday morning with a surface pressure of 952 mb. Southeasterly winds of 30 to 45 mph with gusts up 65 mph will be possible Thursday morning to Friday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Pribilof Islands

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 9:52AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor will remain steady in Minor Flood Stage through midweek. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 6:29AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Colder and Wetter Weather Coming to Yellowstone... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow accumulation of one to two inches, up to 5 inches in the higher elevations.. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Yellowstone National Park.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 6:29AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Wind expected tonight into Thursday... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Wind becoming northwest and increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 to 55 mph. * WHERE...The Bighorn Basin and the Cody Foothills.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 6:29AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow likely Thursday and Thursday night... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Rain changing to snow late tonight, mainly above 7000 feet. Accumulation of 2 to 4 inches possible above 8000 feet; a coating to 2 inches in the lower elevations.

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow.
